meanings.definition: To cool (a gas or liquid) between stages of a process.
meanings.sent1: After the engine heated up, it was time to intercool the air before continuing the production process.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic needed to intercool the engine to prevent overheating during the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to intercool the soup by adding ice cubes, but it turned into a chilly disaster.
meanings.sent4: She intercooled her temper before responding to the rude customer, keeping her cool under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's invention could intercool the liquid in seconds, revolutionizing the cooling process.

meanings.definition: A device used to cool a gas or liquid between stages of a process.
meanings.sent1: The intercool was essential in maintaining the optimal temperature of the liquid during the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The factory invested in a new intercool to improve the efficiency of their production line.
meanings.sent3: The intercool hummed softly, like a tiny cooling superhero in the midst of the hot machinery.
meanings.sent4: The intercool acted as a shield, protecting the delicate components from the heat of the process.
meanings.sent5: With the new intercool in place, the system ran smoothly without any overheating issues.
